Job Title: Safety Specialist

Location: West Milwaukee, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Description

Global Power Components is a privately held, growing manufacturer of UL heavy gauge steel fuel tanks, trailers, large generator enclosures and modular metal enclosures for housing fully-equipped electrical distribution and control equipment.

We have recently moved operations into a newly renovated 300,000 sq. foot facility that will foster our continued growth as we continue to be recognized as the undisputed leaders in our industry.

As a result of our expansion, we are looking for an Safety and Compliance Specialist to join our growing safety team.

Responsibilities

Safety and Compliance

Help Maintain and Improve all Safety Compliance Systems, not Limited to:Operator training, forklift, overhead crane, aerial lifts, etc. Respirator ProgramLockout/TagoutHazard CommunicationSafety AuditsMachine GuardingGeneral Safety RulesAssist with new hire safety training. Assist with periodic Environmental Compliance requirements. Assist with 3rd party inspections and Maintenance ProgramsConduct facility safety audits (Walk-throughâ€™s)Provide and carry out corrective actions. Complete reports and verify corrective actions. Paint department audits/inventoryPPE Assessments for each departmentConduct risk assessments and enforce preventative measures. Conduct toolbox meetings and learning opportunities for employees. Prepare reports of findings with recommendations for corrective actionPerform various duties in support of ongoing production processes as well as new processes, operation and facilities. Enforce safe behavior and workplace practices. Perform routine process audits, e.g., crane operations. Assist Safety Team to investigate incidents, accidents, and near misses. Coordinate Emergency Response activities (medical, fire, severe weather), including updating plans and leading drills. Develop, maintain, monitor, and update compliance to OSHA regulations. Perform various duties in support of Safety Team and Management

Ability to maintain good working relationships with the Production Department, Safety Team, Quality Team, HR and Upper Management is a MUST.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

Global Power Components is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Global Power Components is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Company Description

Global Power Components is a privately held, growing manufacturer of UL heavy gauge steel fuel tanks, trailers, large generator enclosures and modular metal enclosures for housing fully equipped electrical distribution and control equipment.

In 2018 we moved operations into a newly renovated 300,000 sq. foot facility on 51st Street that will foster our continued growth as we continue to be recognized as the undisputed leaders in our industry.
